attributes.action: TRANSITION FROM CONSTITUTIONAL MONARCHY TO CONSTITUTIONAL REPUBLIC
attributes.additional_details: That the present Parliament for the British invite the present President of Ireland to become the First President of a Federal Republic of the British Isles.  In the Federal Republic of the British Isles there will be no impediment to all the Irish being regarded by themselves and by others as equally and as unavoidably British as any of the other People who are indigenous to what principally and indisputably are two Islands of that Name.  The Purpose of an Irish Presidency initiating the Republic is to affirm and assert the End of the Ascendancy of the English in the Affairs of the British.  It will be for a fixed term only.  At its Conclusion the Presidency of the British will rotate between Elected Representatives from each of the Four Home Countries of the British.
